summary: Wind now deterministically drifts physical projectiles (arrows/rocks/torches); ranged targeting preview shows WIND/DRIFT and HIT 0% when the aim point is off-line.
description: Introduces a deterministic per-level wind drift model for physical projectiles (arrows, rocks, torches). Shots are biased by the dungeon’s wind direction/strength; the ranged targeting HUD now shows WIND/DRIFT and suppresses misleading hit chances when drift pushes the projectile line away from the aimed tile.
notes: Add Game::windAdjustShot(): a small deterministic model that biases physical projectile targets (arrows/rocks/torches) based on per-level wind direction/strength and shot distance.
Apply wind drift in combat.cpp for ranged attacks so both player and monsters are affected consistently.
Update ranged targeting preview (src/game_targeting.cpp) to show WIND/DRIFT and display HIT 0% when drift makes the aimed tile fall off the actual projectile line.
